summary: This is a joint letter from the prosecution and defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (S2 20 Cr. 330) submitted to Judge Nathan, regarding proposed juror strikes and including modifications to the defense's previous strikes. It is a procedural communication between legal parties and the court.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Sender of the email submitting the joint letter to the court regarding proposed juror strikes in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: The judge (Judge Nathan) presiding over the case, to whom the joint letter regarding juror strikes is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the document title (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell).

connections.description: Christian Everdell is an attorney involved in the case, likely part of the defense or prosecution team corresponding about jury selection for Maxwell's trial.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Submission of Joint Letter on Juror Strikes
events.description: The prosecution and defense jointly submit a letter to Judge Nathan regarding proposed juror strikes and modifications to the defense's previous strikes in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: The document is a joint submission from the parties in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell regarding jury selection procedures.
It indicates ongoing pre-trial or trial proceedings as of November 2021, specifically focused on juror strikes.
The communication shows coordination between prosecution and defense on procedural matters under the court's supervision.
Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP is the submitting attorney on the correspondence.
The document is marked as confidential and subject to attorney-client privilege considerations.
